adrFormatAddress: 1345 6th Ave 2ND FLOOR, New York, NY 10105, USA

originalText.text: Recently John helped me navigate a problem and he was great. When I reached out to him, he listened to my concerns, and provided me with all possible routes including with and without his assistance.  He is very resourceful, honest, and professional. He was also very sensitive to my situation, and I felt like along with legal assistance, I also got counselling. I was very scared and John helped me get hope while simultaneously solving my problem. I highly recommend seeking John's help if are in need of legal assistance.

originalText.text: Attorney John Howley is very accommodating and helpful in listening and addressing my  concerns. I trust him with his expert advice and I know that he has my best interest always. He is also very responsive and attends to my  concerns immediately. We deserve more lawyers like Attorney John Howley!

originalText.text:
Highly recommend John. He was attentive, fully understood my issue, made a recommendation that was in my best interest, and saw the negotiation through to the end. His professionalism and empathy was something I had not experienced in an attorney previously and it's impressive. John worked with me to the outcome I was hoping for and I am extremely grateful.

If you need top notch counsel, definitely speak with John Howley.

originalText.text:
Hired John Howley for a pregnancy discrimination case. I felt very confident in his work, and was actually looking forward to working with him. John randomly ended representation without reason, via email, no heads up, no prior conversation or indication of anything being wrong. John also did this 2.5 hours before we were scheduled to meet with the attorney  representing my  former employer. My only guess is that John felt offended that I emailed the morning of this meeting asking for information that should have been provided to me without asking: The time he was meeting with the defendant’s attorney, what strategy we were taking, and if this meeting was to start negotiations. Right after asking these questions, John sent that email ending representation & never cared enough to follow up. Extremely unprofessional and quite rude. Again, I felt good about hiring John initially, so this was very bizarre. It’s almost like he doesn’t want to be questioned. There was a minor situation where John took a statement I said out of context when I was letting him know what my O.B said way before I had reason to sue, and said if I didn’t trust him we didn’t need to work together. That should have been my first red flag, as I felt inclined to address that statement then- or consider the first attorney I spoke to. I found it very offputting that me simply informing him of what I was told before this case, made him feel like I didn’t trust him. We were just having a conversation (or so I thought). I ask necessary and relevant questions. I am very thorough, detailed and like to know what is exactly is going on- maybe John didn’t like that. So, if you’re a client like me who want date/time/ and insight on strategies- maybe look elsewhere for representation. He did the exact same thing my employers did to me, and did not feel the need to explain. Lol very odd and weird
Not too upset though, I had a lawyer on standby that took the call he dropped & have new representation that I feel confident in.

EDIT: In response to Johns reply, my emails and iMessages aren’t fabricated. Most of your reviews  are from people who spoke with you, but clearly did not work with you. Hardly any of these reviews speak about results. Additionally, I do however agree with most of these reviews that you INITIALLY were very professional. You abruptly ending representation without warrant, after me asking very basic and general questions. If I were you’d, I’d quit while I’m ahead because I can just post them on tiktok / Twitter for my 19.1K viewers to see. Thank you for your well wishes. Good luck.
